author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) is investigating whether an employee at a Michigan hospital system was fired for refusing to use a patient’s preferred pronouns and assisting in “sex trait modification” procedures, the agency’s Office of Civil Rights announced Friday.   The healthcare worker allegedly requested religious accommodations from certain employment practices…
title: HHS investigating Michigan healthcare system over alleged conscience rights violation

author: Ella Lee
description: A federal judge on Friday said it’s too late to order the recovery of already-deleted Signal messages from key members of President Trump’s Cabinet, largely rejecting a request from an oversight group to get involved.   But U.S. District Judge James Boasberg did order acting National Archivist and Secretary of State Marco Rubio to ask…
title: Judge says it’s too late to order recovery of Trump officials’ Signal messages

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: Iran’s foreign minister told NBC News on Friday that Tehran was not sure it could trust the United States in the wake of numerous Israeli attacks on Iran. The airstrikes from Israel, which have targeted Iranian military and nuclear facilities, came just days before American officials were scheduled to hold nuclear talks mediated by Oman.…
title: Iran unsure it can trust US after Israeli strikes: Top official

author: Jared Gans
description: Washington State Democratic Party Chair Shasti Conrad on Friday won the Democratic National Committee’s (DNC) second open vice chair position after members voted to redo the election amid significant inner turmoil over David Hogg’s role within the party.  Conrad won the spot with almost 56 percent of the vote over DNC member Kalyn Free in…
title: Shasti Conrad wins open DNC vice chair position after Hogg fallout

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump on Friday said it would be difficult for Israel to stop strikes on Iran at this point, a week into the intense conflict between the two nations and two weeks out from the president’s decision on U.S. involvement. “I think it’s very hard to make that request right now,” he said, when pressed…
title: Trump: ‘Hard’ for Israel to stop strikes now

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: President Trump posted Friday on Truth Social that his administration is expecting to make a deal with Harvard after its numerous actions against the university.   “Many people have been asking what is going on with Harvard University and their largescale improprieties that we have been addressing, looking for a solution. We have been working…
title: Trump: Harvard deal expected in ‘next week or so’

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Friday publicly rebuked his director of national intelligence for a second time this week over her testimony earlier this year that the intelligence community did not believe Iran was building a nuclear weapon. “What intelligence do you have that Iran is building a nuclear weapon? Your intelligence community had said they have…
title: Trump says Gabbard ‘wrong’ on whether Iran is building a nuclear weapon

author: Sharon Udasin
description: Applying a market-based approach to Colorado River management could ensure more robust and reliable supplies for farmers, communities and the environment, a new study has found. Without considerable cutbacks in basin-wide water consumption, fish populations could face dire consequences for at least one month of the irrigation season, scientists warned in the study, published Friday…
title: Colorado River ‘water market’ could bring security to farmers, fish and families: Study

author: Julia Manchester
description: Democratic strategist Patti Solis Doyle said that the party lacks a leader, message and agenda when asked about the state of the Democratic Party in an interview that aired on Friday.  “Right now we’re leaderless, we’re messageless, we’re agendaless, we don’t have any alternative ideas to the president and the Republicans right now. So, you…
title: Former Clinton campaign chief on Democrats: ‘We’re leaderless, we’re messageless, we’re agendaless’

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: Sen. Chris Van Hollen (D-Md.) accused Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of long seeking to “drag” the United States into conflict with Iran as lawmakers scramble to respond to the Trump administration’s handling of the Middle East conflict. The Maryland Democrat, who sits on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, was asked during a CNN appearance…
title: Van Hollen: Netanyahu ‘has always wanted to drag’ US into ‘war with Iran’

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The Trump administration gave California a 60-day deadline to overhaul its sex education program or risk losing federal funding.  California must eliminate “all gender ideology references” in its program and curriculum, the Administration for Children and Families at the Department of Health and Human Services said in a letter to the state.  The administration condemned…
title: California given deadline to overhaul sex education program

author: Miranda Nazzaro
description: Pope Leo XIV sounded the alarm this week over artificial intelligence (AI)’s potential impact on young people’s intellectual and neurological development, building upon one of the main focuses of his papacy. The first American pope delivered the message to an annual conference on AI and ethics, part of which took place in the Vatican this…
title: Pope Leo ‘concerned’ about AI’s impact on children

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: Patients and doctors say the latest COVID-19 variant spreading in the U.S. in some cases causes a sore throat so painful it has earned the nickname “razor blade throat.”  The nimbus variant, which is officially known as NB.1.8.1., is a descendant of the omicron and is being monitored by the World Health Organization.   “Your…
title: New COVID-19 variant causes ‘razor blade throat’

author: Michael Toth, opinion contributor
description: In order for the Trump administration's energy dominance agenda to succeed, Michigan and Louisiana need to put aside their climate lawfare and produce more reliable and affordable energy for industrial renaissance.
title: Oil and gas lawsuits are threatening Trump’s energy agenda

author: Ella Lee
description: A federal judge on Friday ordered the release of Mahmoud Khalil, a green card holder and former pro-Palestinian activist at Columbia University who has been detained for more than three months.  U.S. District Judge Michael Farbiarz said Khalil is not a flight risk nor a danger to the community, “period, full stop.” Given those findings,…
title: Judge orders release of former Columbia University activist Mahmoud Khalil

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The Supreme Court on Friday refused two small businesses’ request to announce before the court’s upcoming summer recess if it will take up their challenge to President Trump’s emergency tariffs.  Stressing the tariffs’ sweeping impacts on the economy, the businesses are asking the justices to take up their challenge now rather than let it proceed through…
title: Supreme Court declines to rush petition challenging Trump’s tariffs

author: Julia Shapero
description: Meta, the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, is partnering with Oakley to launch new artificial intelligence (AI) powered glasses, the tech giant announced Friday.  The new smart glasses, like Meta’s earlier Ray-Ban glasses, are equipped with a built-in camera, open-ear speakers and AI capabilities. The Oakley glasses also feature a longer-lasting battery and a…
title: Meta, Oakley partner for AI-powered glasses

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Feras Hamdan, accused of running Ohio Republican Rep. Max Miller's vehicle off the highway, turned himself in to authorities and is awaiting a court appearance on an aggravated menacing charge.
title: Ohio man turns himself in after rep says he was run off road: Police

author: Kevin Sabet, opinion contributor
description: These kids are not using yesterday’s weed.
title: The real youth drug crisis is marijuana

author: Katelyn Harlow
description: After not speaking to each other for eight weeks, Republican nominees Winsome Earle-Sears and John Reid have spoken to each other.
title: Winsome Earle-Sears, John Reid speak to each other for first time in weeks

author: Miranda Nazzaro
description: The founder of the instant messaging Telegram app said he plans to leave his multibillion-dollar fortune to the more than 100 children he has fathered either naturally or through sperm donations. Pavel Durov, in an interview published Thursday with French political magazine Le Point, said he does not differentiate between the six children he fathered…
title: Telegram founder planning to leave fortune to his 100+ children

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Democrats, former GOP Rep. Adam Kinzinger (Ill.) and late-night hosts criticized President Trump on Thursday over his two-week deadline for deciding whether to strike nuclear facilities in Iran.  Trump has often given two-week timelines for major decisions during his first and second terms, as The New York Times pointed out Thursday. Kinzinger said Thursday the…
title: Democrats, Kinzinger criticize Trump’s 2-week deadline on Iran

author: John Mac Ghlionn, opinion contributor
description: Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's potential removal would lead to a power vacuum, chaos, and a regional wildfire, leading to a civil war in a country of 90 million people, with ballistic missiles and regional reach.
title: What happens if Iran falls? Nothing good.

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Rep. Jim Himes expressed caution in praising President Trump's handling of the ongoing military conflict between Israel and Iran, urging the president to use his leverage to negotiate a deal on Iran's nuclear future before the U.S. military becomes involved.
title: Democrat: Trump 2-week Iran deadline ‘not a bad thing’

author: Alex Gangitano
description: Vice President Vance is set to travel to Los Angeles on Friday, a day after a federal appeals ruled President Trump could retain control of the California National Guard in response to the protests over his immigration raids. Vance “will tour a multi-agency Federal Joint Operations Center, a Federal Mobile Command Center, meet with leadership…
title: Vance travels to Los Angeles to meet Marines, visit federal command center

author: Mark Goldfeder, opinion contributor
description: Iran's relentless shadow war against the United States and the free world necessitates a strategy of strength, including sanctions, support for allies and targeted measures to disrupt its nuclear and terror networks, to end its war on the world.
title: President Trump should end Iran’s endless war on the world

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Florida Rep. Maxwell Frost (D) criticized the Trump administration for their deportation policies following national protests regarding Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) raids and removals. “There is no legal process for people,” Frost said during a Thursday appearance on CBS’ “The Late Show with Stephen Colbert.”  “We have ICE federal agents pulling up, terrorizing our…
title: Maxwell Frost: ICE ‘human trafficking’ migrants to other nations

author: Ella Lee
description: The Supreme Court on Friday upheld a law allowing Americans injured by acts of terror in the Middle East to take Palestinian leadership groups to U.S. courts for damages.  In a unanimous decision, the justices ruled the Promoting Security and Justice for Victims of Terrorism Act (PSJVTA) does not violate the Palestinian Authority (PA) and…
title: Supreme Court revives terror victim lawsuits against Palestinian groups

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Rep. Al Green (D-Texas) is urging senators to rename the Russell Senate Office Building on Capitol Hill because of former Sen. Richard Russell's history of opposing civil rights and avowing white supremacy.
title: Democrat calls for renaming of Russell Senate Office Building

author: Michael Bartiromo
description: Hot and muggy conditions are coming for much of the country starting Friday.
title: ‘Heat dome’ to bring scorching temps to much of US: Where will it be hottest?

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The Supreme Court sided with the vaping industry on Friday by rejecting the Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA) bid to limit where companies can challenge product marketing denials.  The 7-2 decision authored by Justice Amy Coney Barrett enables R.J. Reynolds Vapor Company to proceed in the 5th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals, regarded as the nation’s…
title: Supreme Court sides with vaping industry in rejecting FDA venue challenge

author: Julia Shapero
description: Aflac said Friday that it experienced a cybersecurity incident last week that may have impacted files containing social security numbers, health information and other personal information.   The insurance company first detected suspicious activity on its network last Thursday and “promptly initiated our cyber incident response protocols and stopped the intrusion within hours,” according to…
title: Aflac discloses cybersecurity incident

description: Video: UN Security Council meets amid Israel-Iran war President Trump celebrated an appeals court ruling that affirmed his control over the California National Guard, which he ordered deployed amid unrest in Los Angeles. Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) had sued over the action. “BIG WIN in the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals on the President’s core…
title: Live updates: Trump lauds appeals court ‘win’ over Newsom in California National Guard case

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Former President Biden spoke out against efforts to erase history during a Juneteenth speech in Texas, while President Trump did not formally recognize the holiday and expressed concern about having too many non-working holidays.
title: Biden in Juneteenth remarks rips ‘efforts to erase history’

description: The United Nations Security Council will meet on Friday to discuss the war between Israel and Iran, which has entered its second week.  U.N. Secretary-General António Guterres has called for “immediate de-escalation leading to a ceasefire.” Hanging over the conflict is the possibility of the United States joining Israel’s campaign to destroy Iran’s nuclear enrichment…
title: Watch live: UN Security Council meets amid Israel-Iran war

author: Alexander J. Motyl, opinion contributor
description: Putin, in gifting Safronov’s portrait, presumably knew that Trump would appreciate it.
title: Putin gifts Trump an authoritarian kitsch portrait

author: Russell Falcon
description: The recalled mattresses were sold online at Amazon.com from July 2022 to June 2024, for $100-$220.
title: 100K mattresses sold on Amazon recalled over fire hazard

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Parliamentarian Elizabeth MacDonough has ruled that several key pieces of the massive bill to implement President Trump’s agenda run afoul of the Byrd Rule and must be taken out of the package to allow it to pass with a simple majority vote on a special procedural fast-track. The parliamentarian ruled against several provisions under…
title: Senate parliamentarian knocks pieces out of Trump’s megabill

author: Ted Lipien, opinion contributor
description: It is time for Trump officials and members of Congress from both parties to work out a reasonable plan to save and reform Voice of America.
title: Voice of America’s foreign language services are vital to global peace

description: America’s legacy should not be measured by the bombs we dropped, but by the lives we choose to heal.

description: Cue the laugh track, because Bessent’s growth fantasy is a joke when viewed through the lens of history and facts.

description: This is the latest symptom of a disease that’s rapidly metastasizing: the abandonment of merit in favor of ideological box-checking.

description: The impasse over the state and local tax (SALT) deduction cap is deepening as Senate Republicans and House moderates from high-tax blue states remain at a loggerheads, a stalled state-of-play that is threatening to thwart leadership’s goal of enacting the party’s “big, beautiful bill” by July 4. Sen. Markwayne Mullin (R-Okla.) — a former House member…
title: Impasse over SALT cap deepens as House moderates stand firm

author: Ella Lee
description: Justice Clarence Thomas’s shunning of “experts” defending gender-affirming care is delighting conservatives in their assault on liberal influence in academics and medicine, a mission now reaching the courts.  The conservative justice argued in a solo opinion concurring with the court’s 6-3 decision to uphold Tennessee’s transgender youth care ban that so-called experts have jumped on…
title: Justice Thomas delights conservatives in shunning gender-affirming care ‘experts’

author: Alexander Bolton
description: New polling of likely voters in Senate battleground states has found that President Trump’s frequent clashes with federal courts are becoming a hot issue that could put Senate Republican candidates on the defensive in 2026. A poll of 1,000 likely voters in 2026 Senate battlegrounds, obtained exclusively by The Hill, found that 53 percent disapprove…
title: Poll shows Trump’s clash with courts puts Senate GOP on defense

author: Alexander Bolton
description: The Senate version of legislation to enact President Trump’s agenda is hitting new turbulence as conservatives led by Sens. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.), Rick Scott (R-Fla.) and Mike Lee (R-Utah) are demanding deeper spending cuts to address the nation’s $2.2 trillion annual deficit. Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) has focused this week on addressing the…
title: Trump’s megabill hits more trouble as Senate conservatives demand changes

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: A federal appeals court panel late Thursday allowed President Trump to keep the National Guard deployed in Los Angeles, for now.  The three-judge 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals panel unanimously extended its pause of a judge’s order finding Trump’s deployment illegal and forcing him to return control of the troops to California Gov. Gavin…
title: Appeals court allows Trump to keep National Guard deployed, for now

author: Rachel Scully
description: ChatGPT can harm an individual’s critical thinking over time, a new study suggests. Researchers at MIT’s Media Lab asked subjects to write several SAT essays and separated subjects into three groups — using OpenAI’s ChatGPT, using Google’s search engine and using nothing, which they called the “brain‑only” group. Each subject’s brain was monitored through electroencephalography…
title: ChatGPT use linked to cognitive decline: MIT research

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Journalist John Stossel said President Trump is an “arrogant bully” during a special, John Stossel: Give Me Liberty!, set to air Sunday at 7 p.m. ET on NewsNation, while commending policy changes implemented by the White House.  “He’s an arrogant bully, but I love it that he’s changing the way things were,” Stossel told Connell…
title: Stossel calls Trump ‘arrogant bully’ but supports him targeting DEI, university funding
